name: Afritada
description:
Afritada is a popular Filipino stew dish featuring chicken, beef, or pork braised in a tomato sauce base with carrots, potatoes, and bell peppers. It is a classic comfort food that is typically served with warm white rice.

The name "Afritada" is derived from the Spanish word "fritada," meaning "fried," referring to the initial step of pan-frying the meat and aromatics before simmering them in the sauce. The dish has Spanish colonial origins but has been adapted over time to suit local Filipino tastes.
